attributes.action: Make 2023 A-levels and GCSEs be altered like the current year 11s and year 13s
attributes.additional_details: Current year 12s got their GCSEs altered; they can't be doing A-levels when they didn't get to experience official GCSEs. I strongly feel that year 10s shouldn't be doing GCSEs when they missed out many topics in years 8 and 9 due to covid. From science practicals, drama, IT, food technology, PE, music, computer science, english and even languages.
attributes.background: Parliament should consider how current year 12 and 10s have been effected from covid within schools. As we all know, covid has been a disruption to learning and I firmly feel that year 12 and 10s need adaptions on their 2023 exams as they have not had all the lessons that they need for the exams.

rejection.details:
We think this petition is similar

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/611680

If you'd like something different, you could start a new petition setting out exactly what you'd like to see happen.
